TITLE: Starting the Sample App Development Server
DESCRIPTION: npm command to start the React development server and run the sample application locally, demonstrating CometChat features in action.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cometchat/cometchat-uikit-react/blob/v6/sample-app/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
npm start
```

----------------------------------------

DESCRIPTION: npm command to install all required dependencies for the React sample application as specified in its package.json file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cometchat/cometchat-uikit-react/blob/v6/sample-app/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
npm install
```

TITLE: Cloning the CometChat React UI Kit Repository
DESCRIPTION: Git command to clone the CometChat UI Kit for React repository, which contains the sample application code.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cometchat/cometchat-uikit-react/blob/v6/sample-app/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/cometchat/cometchat-uikit-react.git
```

TITLE: Checking out the v6 Branch
DESCRIPTION: Git command to switch to the v6 branch of the repository, which contains the latest version of the CometChat UI Kit for React.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cometchat/cometchat-uikit-react/blob/v6/sample-app/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
git checkout v6
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Navigating to the Sample App Directory
DESCRIPTION: Command to change directory to the sample-app folder within the cloned repository where the sample application code is located.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cometchat/cometchat-uikit-react/blob/v6/sample-app/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
cd cometchat-uikit-react/sample-app
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing npm globally with Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Command for installing the latest version of npm globally using npm itself. This is a prerequisite for setting up the CometChat React Sample App.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cometchat/cometchat-uikit-react/blob/v6/sample-app/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
npm install npm@latest -g
```

## Enhancements

DESCRIPTION: Bug fixes addressing issues with info page closure, chat deletion, transfer ownership modal visibility, leave group option display, and group ownership transfer updates.

CODE:

## [6.0.3] - 11-04-2025

## New
- None

## Enhancements
- None

## Fixes
- Fixed an issue where the info page in the React Sample App did not close after creating a new group.
- Fixed the issue where deleting a chat did not work for newly created conversations.
- Resolved the visibility issue of the transfer ownership modal on some mobile devices.
- Corrected the visibility of the "Leave group" option in the Sample App when the owner is the only member in the group.
- Resolved an issue where group options and scope were not updated for the logged-in user after transferring group ownership.

TITLE: Validating Workspace Base URL and Region Format in TypeScript
DESCRIPTION: A utility function that validates the format of workspace details by checking that the base URL follows a valid pattern and that the region is either 'us', 'eu', or 'in'. Returns true if the format is valid and false otherwise.
SOURCE: https://github.com/cometchat/cometchat-uikit-react/blob/v6/sample-app/LICENSE.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: typescript
CODE:
```
const validateWorkspaceFormat = (
  baseUrl: string,
  region: string
): boolean => {
  if (!baseUrl || !region) {
    return false;
  }

  try {
    //regex to match if the url starts with cometchat_ or chat_ and ends with .api-us.cometchat.io, .api-eu.cometchat.io or .api-in.cometchat.io
    const baseUrlRegex = /^(cometchat_|chat_)[a-zA-Z0-9_-]+(\.(api-(us|eu|in))\.cometchat\.io)$/;
    //regex to check if region is us, eu or in
    const regionRegex = /^(us|eu|in)$/;

    return baseUrlRegex.test(baseUrl) && regionRegex.test(region);
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(error);
    return false;
  }
};

export { validateWorkspaceFormat };
```
